Kentucky-Providence basketball live blog

The Cats and Friars tip off at 2 p.m. at Rupp Arena.

Kentucky-Providence basketball live blog

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 2:19 p.m. EST November 30, 2014
Buy Photo

Kentucky guard Devin Booker shoots a three point basket in the first half. Booker finished with 19 on 5-6 three point shooting. The University of Kentucky Men's Basketball team hosted Texas-Arlington, Tuesday, Nov. 25, 2014 at Rupp Arena in Lexington. Photo by Jonathan Palmer, Special to the CJ(Photo: Jonathan Palmer/Special to The Courier-Journal)Buy Photo

1 CONNECT 4 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Refresh regularly (or click here) for updates during the University of Kentucky's 2 p.m. Sunday basketball game against Providence at Rupp Arena.

11:02, 1H: Heading into the under-12 timeout, UK's missed each of its last five shots. Meanwhile, Providence is on a 12-2 run over six minutes and leads 12-8 on a Ladontae Henton 3-pointer.

12:24, 1H: From a 6-0 hole, Providence has rallied to take a 9-8 lead on UK. Center Carson Desrosiers has 5 of the Friars' points, and they're out-rebounding the Cats 7-2.

13:42, 1H: A fast-paced opening left UK's starting platoon in through a late under-16 media timeout with the Cats ahead 8-7. Karl-Anthony Towns picked up his first foul at the break but leads UK with 4 early points.

Texas, by the way, got a game-winner with 2.2 seconds to play at UConn. It'll be a top 10 matchup when the Cats and Longhorns meet Friday night.

Texas visits No. 1 Kentucky Friday. They have the bigs to at least make it interesting.

— Adam Zagoria (@AdamZagoria) November 30, 2014

14:33, 1H: Providence has nearly matched UK's hot-shooting start, connecting on 3 of 5 shots to open. It's an 8-7 Cats lead.

16:02, 1H: The Cats and Friars waited only so long for TV. Under way at Rupp Arena, Karl-Anthony Towns hit UK's first bucket and Andrew Harrison added another as part of a 3 for 3 start. The Cats lead 6-3.

20:00, 1H: UK will send out its regular Blue Platoon to start this one, while Providence lists hobbling starting point guard Kris Dunn in its lineup. Dunn, a former McDonald's All American, averages 7 assists.

By the way, Michigan State leads Kansas 36-35 at the half while Texas and UConn battle to the buzzer.

The tip at Rupp Arena should hold for TV, which is waiting on Longhorns-Huskies to finish up.

Late start in Rupp Arena not ESPN's fault, #BBN. Game management guys off by 5 minutes. Sorry about that.

— Fran Fraschilla (@franfraschilla) November 30, 2014

PREGAME: We'll learn plenty about the Cats today, who in facing No. 25 Providence will also get final scores from a pair of noteworthy games around the country.

Current No. 7 Texas, the Cats' next opponent, is locked in a battle with 24th-ranked UConn. And as UK battles the Friars, Kansas and Michigan State are dueling in the Orlando Classic's championship game.

So along with what's happening at Rupp Arena, expect some updates on those as well.

Best way for Kentucky fans to get past a football loss to Louisville... pic.twitter.com/o3D6vHf9mN

— Adam Himmelsbach (@AdamHimmelsbach) November 30, 2014

--Two things to watch for UK: Can Devin Booker, who's averaged 17.3 points per game in the Cats' last three, remain hot? And will the defense, which hasn't allowed a foe to shoot better than 38 percent all season, follow?

--The Friars, who may play Sunday without starting point guard Kris Dunn (ankle), are in the top 25 of the Coaches Poll for the first time since the end of the 2004 season. They're receiving votes in the AP Top 25.

--Providence and UK have met just twice -- in the 1976 NIT and then last season at the Barclays Center. The Cats won both matchups.

--Against No. 1 teams, Providence is 2-11 all time. The most-recent victory came in 2009 over then-Big East Conference rival Pittsbrugh.

--For more pregame reading, check out a game preview featuring Dakari Johnson's improved free throw shooting (http://cjky.it/1vYHniD) as well as matchups and story lines (http://cjky.it/1y9IQCR) from UK beat writer Kyle Tucker.

Once a year a UK game coincides with a gun show adjacent to Rupp and I'm briefly terrified until I realize that's it. pic.twitter.com/7WrUuCz1K5

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) November 30, 2014

F Karl-Anthony Towns

Projected UK White Platoon

Projected Providence Starters

C Carson Desrosiers
